channel.title: [WIP] Legit World Switcher
channel.description:
http://sneamia.net/junk/rshome/
Looks just like the RS Homepage, right? I even set up a chron to get the latest news and site updates. But that's not the best part.
Click through to the world list. That's the beauty. Can you tell the difference? Look at World 2.
That's it. And look at the address bar. Two of my biggest pet peeves, fixed.
There are two distinct advantages over the main RS website. First, it allows access into full worlds, something the official website cannot do. Second, it lets you link directly to the [url=http://sneamia.net/junk/rshome/slj.ws]serverlist page[/url] or any page you desire.
The only problem is I haven't exactly worked out actually opening a world, a) because it's 12 in the morning and b) it checks for iframes, which is a pain in the buttocks.
I'm really disoriented. Maybe I explained it better in my pm to therealjdb:
[quote="xxlegitxx"]Hey, jdb, just wondering if you could approve this site:
http://sneamia.net/junk/rshome/
or more specifically - http://sneamia.net/junk/rshome/slj.ws
I know it's the exact replica of the RS Homepage. Let me explain.
It will be similar to a worldswitcher when it's completed, except I like to think of it as a slightly modified RS site. Normally the server page in RS has all the information on each world stored in JS. But if I write a tiny mod, instead of making full worlds unaccessible, they are still visitable. And instead of showing FULL, it shows the actual number of players (anywhere from 1975 - 2000, I believe).
It has the advantage of being familiar to those used to the RS website, while it also allows access to full worlds. And it removes that gay iframe dependency runescape uses.
[...] I know absolutely no Java, so you can trust me not to keylog.[/quote]
To be honest, I was originally weighing two possibilities as I started ripping the RS homepage: a) work it all out, make a private server, and keylog for accounts; b) just make a site and host a .zip file for people who want to set up a RS-style homepage.
But a worldswitcher would be so much more useful for more people. Though the fact that it looks exactly like the RS official site makes it seem it's intention is to scam, I can assure you it is not. It doesn't even work. And I will work out a way to put an obnoxious disclaimer for everyone to KNOW immediately they aren't on the real RS page.

item.title: [WIP] Legit World Switcher
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Crack Miners:

Well, the progress is very good, and it is a very good concept, but the part that it lacks is graphical intrigue. You get to the client, and you have ad’s underneath, and some very skinny-looking tools on the right side. I could gladly help you with the graphics. You using dreamweaver by any chance, or just standard HTML?

The ads are there to stay, unless I can find some other way of compensation. Show me what you’re thinking of, and I’ll work it out. I keep the frames as is, because frankly, I’d rather let people be able to resize each frame to their liking more than aesthetics. As I said, it’s a WIP, and usually, design comes last. Not to mention it’s best viewed in Opera. But yea, if you could sketch something out, I’ll see if it is what I need, and we can work something out. And yes, I’m working on DW CS3, and it’s standard HTML.

ThugLife:

This is very nice, well put together as well.

Thanks, I appreciate your words of praise.

exe626:

Adding an IRC window into the bottom right would be awesome, tbh.

I’m not exactly sure how much room a 1024 x 768 monitor can show, because im on a 1280 x 1024 (?), so I probably left more empty space than necessary. I was thinking of an IRC client, but I’m not exactly sure how I’d include that. You think it would be best Java based? sppt showed me a php based IRC bot, maybe I could work some AJAX out.

billygotshot:

umm you have to fix the part when you click on a free world you cant see half the client because of the add at the bottom =\ and that add at the top

You should be able to drag that lower bar, and I changed the dimensions for you guys on free worlds.

[quote=“goatee, post:12, topic:143180”]Legit? JAGeX will still be pissed.

Anyway it works really well.[/quote]

The legit part was pulled from my name. And in regards to the pissed part, the only thing I can see them getting pissed at is allowing access to full worlds. And mirroring their site.

exe626:

Just click with the roller on your mouse and scroll down.

Yea, some browsers support that.

killerman93:

This is extremely cool.

Thanks.

Bobby:

this is undectectable right? no bannage?

I can’t say it’s undetectable, because I don’t understand the limitations Java or JS. From what I’ve gathered, they may be able to locate the domain it is being accessed from, and see that it allows access to full worlds. But, to counter this, I give the option of adding a &s to the end of the sln.ws (server list) page (it should look something like http://sneamia.net/junk/rshome/slj.ws?plugin=0&lores.x=207&lores.y=74&s, and that makes it look exactly like the normal server list page, with no link to full worlds. Therefore, Jagex can’t tell which users use the &s and therefore, because my site offers both options, they cannot claim everyone on this site is breaking that rule, and you shouldn’t be banned for that. But seriously, google ‘world switcher.’ Not even ‘rs world switcher,’ just ‘world switcher.’ Most of those world switchers allow you to access full worlds, and to my knowledge, no one has been banned. Just look at world 2… do you think those 2000 people actually refreshed the normal serverlist page until they got in? No. They used a world switcher.

Read full topic
